definition: to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
I/me/my
I/me/my

sentences.english: Two people love false very much in love, but decided to venture.
sentences.chinese: 兩人假意卿卿我我，實則決定冒險行動。

sentences.english: They've been spending a lot of time together, nudge nudge, wink wink.
sentences.chinese: 他們老混在一起，眉來眼去，卿卿我我的。

sentences.english: How can I tell him that I just don't like being lovey-dovey?
sentences.chinese: 我就是不喜歡卿卿我我的，我該怎麼告訴他呢？
